message.content: {"number":"1","is_real_bug":false,"is_fixed":false,"found_pointer":[],"fixed_pointer":[],"bug_kind":null,"how_found":null,"reproduction_pattern_and_input":[],"log":null,"summary":"The issue reports a build error on CentOS due to compiler warnings treated as errors, specifically uninitialized variables in generated parser code. {"number":"2","is_real_bug":true,"is_fixed":true,"found_pointer":[],"fixed_pointer":[{"type":"Other","value":"git master"}],"bug_kind":"SEMANTIC","how_found":null,"reproduction_pattern_and_input":[{"pattern":"\\\\777","input":null}],"log":null,"summary":"The issue reports that octal character escapes like \\777 are incorrectly accepted and truncated to \\377, which is a semantic bug in pattern interpretation. The reproduction pattern \\777 is extracted from the description."}
